channel.title: Butterfly on AI-Lab
channel.description: Recent content in Butterfly on AI-Lab

item.title: Nature-Inspired Designs Win Awards in Bionic Design Competition
item.description: Under the guidance of Dr Lan, two student teams from the lab took part in the 2025 Bionic Design Competition (仿生設計競賽), an event showcasing nature-inspired innovation for sustainability. Among 78 entries, both teams received awards for their nature-inspired designs: one received a Merit Award for their bio-inspired stingray underwater vehicle, while the other was awarded Honourable Mention for a butterfly-inspired micro air vehicle. The competition, supported by Biomimicry Taiwan, promotes sustainable innovation rooted in natural principles, addressing global challenges from disaster resilience to environmental health.

item.title: New Journal Paper on Drones
item.description:
Great news! The paper titled ‘A Neural Network Approach to Estimate Transient Aerodynamic Properties of a Flapping Wing System’ by Lan et al. has been published in the journal Drones. Congratulations!

For more information please refer to https://doi.org/10.3390/drones6080210.
